skill.name: error-detective
skill.description: Systematic debugging and error resolution using the TRACE framework (Trace, Read, Analyze, Check, Execute). Use when debugging errors, analyzing stack traces, investigating failures, root cause analysis, or troubleshooting production issues.
skill.summary: Systematic debugging and error resolution using the TRACE framework (Trace, Read, Analyze, Check, Ex...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and methodology skill with a Python helper script for stack trace parsing. The script reads user-specified files and writes to a local .debug_sessions directory. No network calls, no external command execution, and no sensitive data access patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Controlled filesystem access in debug helper
low_findings.description: The debug_helper.py script opens and reads files specified by the user for stack trace parsing and log analysis. It also creates a local .debug_sessions directory and writes JSON session files. This is a legitimate capability for a debugging tool. The script only accesses files explicitly provided by the user or created within its own working directory.

content.user_title: Debug errors systematically with TRACE framework
content.value_statement: Debugging errors takes too long when you do not have a clear process. This skill provides a systematic TRACE framework to trace, read, analyze, check, and execute fixes for any error across Python, JavaScript, Java, and Go.
actual_capabilities: Parse stack traces from Python, JavaScript, Java, and Go
Apply TRACE framework for systematic debugging
Identify error patterns and root causes across languages
Analyze log files for error frequency and patterns
Manage debug sessions with timestamped notes
limitations: Does not execute code or modify your application
Does not connect to external services or APIs
Does not provide real-time debugging or breakpoints
Requires you to provide error messages and stack traces

use_cases.title: Debug production errors
use_cases.description: Debug crashes and exceptions in your code using systematic analysis techniques

use_cases.title: Investigate failures
use_cases.description: Analyze application logs and stack traces to find root causes of production incidents

use_cases.title: Learn debugging skills
use_cases.description: Develop systematic debugging habits with structured methodology and real examples

prompt_templates.title: Debug an error
prompt_templates.scenario: I have an error to debug
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me debug this error using the TRACE framework. Error: [paste error message]

prompt_templates.title: Analyze stack trace
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse and analyze this stack trace. Identify the root cause and fix. Stack trace: [paste stack trace]

prompt_templates.title: Find patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these log entries for error patterns. What are the most common errors and their causes?

prompt_templates.title: Compare languages
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare how to debug [TypeError/NullPointerException/AttributeError] in Python, JavaScript, and Java

output_examples.input: Debug this Python error: Traceback (most recent call last): File app.py line 45 in get_user user.profile.to_dict() AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'to_dict'
output: Error Type: AttributeError - None object accessed
Root Cause: user.profile is None, likely user has no profile
Fix: Add null check or ensure profile creation

best_practices: Always read the complete error message before debugging
Reproduce the error consistently before attempting fixes
Change one variable at a time when testing hypotheses
Document your findings and solutions for future reference
anti_patterns: Skipping error messages and guessing at the problem
Making multiple changes before identifying the root cause
Fixing symptoms without addressing the underlying issue
Not verifying that the fix resolves the original error

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, and Go stack traces and error patterns

faq.question: What is the TRACE framework?
faq.answer: Trace, Read, Analyze, Check, Execute - a five-step systematic debugging methodology

faq.question: Can this skill fix my code automatically?
faq.answer: No. It provides analysis and guidance. You implement the fixes based on the recommendations

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill processes data locally. The helper script reads only files you specify

faq.question: Why does my error say it worked yesterday?
faq.answer: Check recent changes, dependency updates, configuration changes, or time-dependent logic

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax issues. This skill helps debug runtime errors and logical issues
